intro: Icacorea novitensis, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal and lowland areas, preferring moist, well-drained soils. Its leaves are long and narrow, often used traditionally by Māori for weaving and other crafts. Icacorea novitensis plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, supporting various insect and bird species.
